intro: Pisophaca proxima, commonly known as the small flax or narrowleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in textile production, it has been cultivated in some regions.
